Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve is the flagship brand of bourbon whiskey owned by the Old Rip Van Winkle Distillery company.
Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve is distilled and bottled by the Sazerac Company at its Buffalo Trace Distillery in Frankfort Kentucky.
Soda sữa hột gà or egg soda is a sweet drink made from egg yolk, sweetened condensed milk and club soda from Mainland Southeast Asia.
In addition to Clix Malt Liquor the Grand Valley Brewing Company created a Stout beer using the same process.
Biała Dama is an unflavored vodka produced by Polmos Łańcut.
Pernod Ricard has identified Blenders Pride and Imperial Blue, Royal Stag, Chivas Regal as the company five core brands in India.
The Coco López brand expanded to include mixed flavors including Coco López Bloody Mary, Coco López lemonade, Coco López mango.
Farmers Union Iced Coffee is a flavoured milk drink popular in Australia primarily the state of South Australia.
Old Ezra 101 is a brand of Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey bottled under the name  Ezra Brooks Distilling.
A&W Cream Soda is a cream soda carbonated soft drink introduced by A&W Root Beer in 1986.
It is sometimes confused with its sister brand Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve.
The brand main national competitors are Royal Challenge, Signature and Antiquity from United Spirits Ltd and Peter Scot from Khoday India Limited.
The rights to the Chicago Root Beer brand are owned by Cool Mountain Beverages Inc.
Coca wine is an alcoholic beverage combining wine with cocaine.
To accommodate recent additions of non coffee based beverages Chai Latte and Vanilla Creme.
Original New York Seltzer is a carbonated soft drink.
White Mountain Cooler was an alcoholic beverage that debuted in 1985.
Small batch bourbon offerings and others include Noah Mill, Rowan's Creek and Pure Kentucky XO.
Ck vodka is a vodka produced by Polmos Łańcut from grain spirits and demineralized spring water.
Benjamin Prichard's Tennessee Whiskey is a brand of Tennessee whiskey produced in the small community of Kelso, Tennessee.
Main competitors are Blenders Pride from Pernod Ricard and Royal Challenge from United Spirits Limited.
Papelón con limón is a refreshing Venezuelan beverage made with papelón water and lemon or lime juice.
Guinness Foreign Extra Stout is a stout produced by Guinness Brewery an Irish brewing company owned by Diageo a drinks multinational.
Five hour Energy is an American made energy shot manufactured by Living Essentials LLC.
Meyenberg Goat Milk is a brand of goat milk products.
General Foods International produces several different flavors of instant coffee.
DeLeón Tequila is a brand of the alcoholic beverage tequila.
DeLeón Tequila is certified as 100% blue weber agave tequila.
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve is often regarded as one of the finest bourbons in the world.
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve can be extremely difficult to find due to its very low production and high demand.
Milk is a nutrient rich, white liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
Milk is the primary source of nutrition for infant mammals.
Milk contains many other nutrients including protein and lactose.
Interspecies consumption of milk is not uncommon particularly among humans.
Humans consume the milk of other mammals.
As an agricultural product milk also called dairy milk.
Dairy farms produced about 730 million tonnes of milk in 2011 from 260 million dairy cows.
India is the world largest producer of milk.
India is the leading exporter of skimmed milk powder.
India exports few other milk products.
New Zealand, Germany and the Netherlands are the largest exporters of milk products.
China and Russia were the world largest importers of milk and milk products until 2016.
Both countries became self sufficient contributing to a worldwide glut of milk.
Throughout the world, more than six billion people consume milk and milk products.
India being a net importer of milk products in the future.
Aquafina is a brand of purified bottled water products produced by PepsiCo.
Aquafina brand name is also licensed for use on multiple skin care products.
Aquafina was first distributed in Wichita Kansas in 1994.
Aquafina is sold across United States, Canada, Spain, Lebanon, Turkey, GCC countries, Iran, Egypt, Morocco, Vietnam, Pakistan and India.
Aquafina competes with Dasani from The Coca Cola Company and Deja Blue from Dr.Pepper Snapple.
As of 2009 Aquafina represented 13.4 percent of domestic bottled water sales in United States.
Aquafina is number one bottled water brand as measured by retail sales.
Aquafina Pure Water the primary unflavored product produced under the Aquafina brand.
Aquafina Pure Water  is derived from local municipal tap water sources and goes through a purification process that incorporates reverse osmosis, ultraviolet.
Beginning on July 27, 2007 a disclaimer was added to each bottle of Aquafina stating the water comes from a public source.
In Canada the current bottle of Aquafina water displays Demineralized Treated Water.
Flavored variations are produced under Aquafina brand name.
Flavored variations of Aquafina are labeled as containing no calories and no carbohydrates.
Aquafina FlavorSplash was first introduced in 2005.
Aquafina FlavorSplash is a flavored water product line which is non carbonated and artificially sweetened with Sucralose.
As of 2011 Aquafina FlavorSplash is produced in six flavors: Grape, Strawberry Kiwi, Wild Berry, Raspberry, Lemon and Peach Mango.
Aquafina Sparkling is a carbonated line of flavored water.
Aquafina Sparkling production was discontinued in US in late 2010..
Other former products included Aquafina Alive and Aquafina plus both of which have been discontinued in US.
As of 2011 Aquafina Alive and Aquafina plus lines were still in production in other markets such as Canada.
Kykeon was an Ancient Greek drink of various descriptions.
Some kykeon were made mainly of water, barley and naturally occurring substances.
Other kykeon were made with wine and grated cheese.
It is widely believed that kykeon usually refers to a psychoactive compounded brew.
A kykeon was used at the climax of the Eleusinian Mysteries to break a sacred fast.
A kykeon is also mentioned as a favourite drink of Greek peasants.
A kykeon is mentioned in Homeric texts.
The Iliad describes kykeon as consisting of Pramnian wine, barley and grated goat cheese.
In the Odyssey Circe adds some honey and pours her magic potion into kykeon.
The goddess refuses red wine but accepts kykeon made from water, barley and pennyroyal.
Kykeon was supposed to have digestive properties.
Hermes recommends Kykeon in Aristophanes Peace to the hero who ate too much dry fruit and nuts.
Aristocrats shunned Kykeon as a peasant drink.
Theophrastus depicts in his Characters a peasant who goes to the Ecclesia drunk with Kykeon.
It is posited that the barley used in the Eleusinian Kykeon was parasitized by ergot.
For more on the possibilities of Kykeon psychoactive properties.
In Vedic tradition soma or haoma is a ritual drink of importance among the early Indians.
The Rigveda mentions soma particularly in the Soma Mandala.
In the Avestan literature the entire Yasht 20 and Yasna 911 treat of haoma.
Texts describe the preparation of soma by means of extracting the juice from a plant.
In both ancient religions of Historical Vedic religion and Zoroastrianism name of soma and plant are the same.
Bevo was a non alcoholic malt beverage or near beer.
Bevo was brewed in United States by Anheuser Busch company beginning in the early 20th century.
Bevo enjoyed greatest success during time of Prohibition, when beer, wine and distilled liquors were illegal for thirteen years.
The Anheuser Busch company started brewing Bevo when alcoholic beverages were prohibited in 1916 by the United States armed forces.
Bevo was by far the most popular of the many cereal beverages or near beers of the time.
At peak of popularity in the early 1920s more than five million cases of Bevo were sold annually.
Labels on the bottles billed it as Bevo the Beverage.
The name Bevo was coined from the word beverage and the Slavic language word for beer pivo.
Some Bevo advertising featured the character Renard the Fox.
Anheuser Busch built a series of boat bodied cars in its St.Louis shops called Bevo Boats which were used for promotion.
A contemporary advertisement read Cooling and invigorating Bevo the Beverage.
The milk or water may contain bacteria BEVO never does.
Bevo became part of the popular culture of the time.
Bevo is mentioned in various popular songs and vaudeville skits of the era.
The ubiquitous lyric How Dry I Am Bevo is featured prominently.
In late 1920s smuggled bootleg beer and liquor as well as homebrew cut into Bevo marketshare.
A caudle or caudel was a hot drink that recurred in various guises throughout British cuisine from the Middle Ages into Victorian times.
A caudle was thick and sweet and seen as particularly suitable and sustaining for invalids and new mothers.
At some periods of history caudle recipes were based on milk and eggs like eggnog.
Later caudle variants were more similar to a gruel a sort of drinkable oatmeal porridge.
Like original forms of posset a caudle was usually alcoholic.
The word caudle came into Middle English via the Old North French word caudle ultimately derived from Latin caldus warm.
A spirit and mixer is any combination of one spirit with one non alcoholic component such as gin and tonic.
Whereas a cocktail generally comprises three or more ingredients.
Drinking water also known as potable water is water that is safe to drink or to use for food preparation.
The amount of drinking water required to maintain good health varies.
Americans on average drink one litre of water per day.
For those who work in a hot climate up to 16 litres of water a day may be required.
Liquid water along with air pressure, nutrients and solar energy is essential for life.
Typically in developed countries tap water meets drinking water quality standards.
Only a small proportion of tap water is actually consumed or used in food preparation.
Nearly 4.2 billion people worldwide had access to tap water.
More people die from unsafe water than from war.
In Sub Saharan Africa access to potable water ranged from 40% to 80% of the population.
Schaefer Beer is a brand of American beer first produced in New York City during 1842 by F & M Schaefer Brewing Company.
In the mid 1970s Schaefer Beer was one of the top selling beers in the US ranking as high as fifth in both the 1950 and 1970 rankings.
Yoo hoo is an American brand of chocolate drink that was developed by Natale Olivieri in New Jersey in 1928.
Yoo hoo is manufactured by Keurig Dr Pepper.
As of 2019 Yoo hoo is primarily made from water, HFCS and whey.
Coca wine is an alcoholic beverage combining wine with cocaine.
Coca wine popular brand was Vin Mariani developed in 1863 by French Corsican chemist and entrepreneur Angelo Mariani.
Coca wine became illegal in United States when other main drug alcohol was banned later with Eighteenth Amendment in 1920.
A latte is a coffee drink made with espresso and steamed milk.
The term latte as used in English is a shortened form of Italian caffè e latte, caffelatte or caffellatte.
The term latte is a shortened form of Italian caffè e latte which means milk coffee.
In northern Europe and Scandinavia term café au lait has traditionally been used for combination of espresso and milk.
In France the café latte is mostly known from the original Italian name of the drink.
Caffè latte or caffelatte a combination of espresso and steamed milk equivalent to a latte is in French called grand crème and in German Milchkaffee or Wiener Melange.
Variants include the chocolate flavored mocha or replacing the coffee with another drink base such as masala chai, mate, matcha, turmeric or rooibos.
Carlton Draught is a beer made in Australia by Carlton & United Breweries.
Lassi is a popular traditional dahi based drink that originated in the Indian subcontinent.
Lassi is a blend of yoghurt, water, spices and sometimes fruit.
Namkeen lassi is similar to doogh while sweet and mango lassis are like milkshakes.
Bhang lassi is infused with the drug cannabis in the form of bhang.
Chaas is a similar drink of a thinner consistency.
Between 1863 and 1868 Angelo Mariani started marketing a coca wine called Vin Tonique Mariani which was made from Bordeaux wine and coca leaves.
Vin Mariani that was to be exported contained 7.2mg per ounce in order to compete with the higher cocaine content of similar drinks in United States.
Advertisements for Vin Mariani claimed that it would restore health, strength, energy and vitality.
Flavored milk is a sweetened dairy drink made with milk, sugar, food colorings and artificial or natural flavorings.
Flavored milk is often pasteurized using ultra high temperature treatment which gives it a longer shelf life than plain milk.
Pre mixed flavored milk is sold in the refrigerated dairy case alongside other milk products.
Flavored sweetened powders or syrups which are added to plain milk are available along with flavored straws.
Ale 8 One is a regional ginger and citrus flavored soft drink.
Ale 8 One is distributed primarily to brick and mortar retailers in Kentucky.
Ale 8 One could be described as a ginger pop with a kick.
Ale 8 One is a ginger and citrus blend containing less carbonation and fewer calories than conventional soda.
Ale 8 One is bottled by Ale 8 One Bottling Company in Winchester Kentucky.
Amazake is a traditional sweet low alcohol Japanese drink made from fermented rice.
Amazake dates from the Kofun period and it is mentioned in the Nihon Shoki.
Amazake is part of the family of traditional Japanese foods made using the koji mold that includes miso, soy sauce and sake.
There are several recipes for amazake that have been used for hundreds of years.
By another popular recipe sake kasu is simply mixed with water but usually sugar is added.
Amazake can be used as a dessert, snack, natural sweetening agent, baby food, salad dressing or smoothie.
The traditional drink prepared by combining amazake and wate heated to a simmer.
Amazake often topped with a pinch of finely grated ginger was popular with street vendors.
Amazake it is still served at inns, teahouses and at festivals.
Many Shinto shrines provide or sell amazake in the New Year.
In the 20th century an instant  amazake version became available.
Amazake is believed to be very nutritious.
Amazake contains vitamin B1, B2, B6, folic acid, dietary fiber, oligosaccharide, cysteine, arginine and glutamine.
Amazake is often considered a hangover cure in Japan.
Similar beverages include the Chinese jiuniang, Korean gamju and Vietnamese cơm rượu.
Caffè corretto an Italian beverage consists of a shot of espresso with a small amount of liquor usually grappa and sometimes sambuca or brandy.
Caffè corretto is also known outside Italy as an espresso corretto.
Caffè corretto is ordered as un caffè corretto alla grappa, corretto alla sambuca or corretto al cognac depending on the desired liquor.
Most Italian bartenders prepare a caffè corretto simply adding a few drops of the desired liquor into an espresso shot.
In Spain a similar drink is known as carajillo.
In Portugal is known as Café com Cheirinho.
In Sweden in France the Pousse Café or Café Calva.
In Norway and Denmark as kaffekask, karsk or kaffegök.
Mug Root Beer is a brand name of root beer made by New Century Beverage Company of San Francisco California a subsidiary of PepsiCo.
Mug Root Beer was originally produced by Belfast Beverage Company in San Francisco, California during the 1940s as Belfast Root Beer.
An advertisement for Belfast Root Beer appears as early as 1947.
The product name was later changed to Mug Old Fashioned Root Beer.
An advertisement for Belfast Old Fashioned Mug Root Beer appears as early as 1952.
In the late 1960s Sugar Free Mug now Diet Mug Root Beer was introduced.
Mug Cream Soda and Diet Mug Cream Soda were later introduced but they are not as widely available.
Mug Root Beer is manufactured by independent bottlers under the authority of New Century Beverage Company.
The Mug features the company mascot a bulldog named Dog holding a mug of root beer.
Sahti is a Finnish beer made from malted and unmalted grains including barley, rye and oats.
Traditionally Sahti is flavored with juniper.
Sahti is top fermented and many have a banana flavor due to isoamyl acetate from the use of baking yeast although may also be used in fermenting.
Sahti was traditionally brewed as a farmhouse ale but commercial versions are now available.
Commercial sahti is usually 8% ABV.
In Finland due to the higher percentage of alcohol in sahti is only sold in commercial sahti breweries, pubs or state owned Alko stores.
Sahti has to be stored cold until consumption and is therefore not available in all Alko branches.
The etymology of the word sahti is not certain.
Apple cider is also called sweet cider or soft cider or simply cider.
Apple cider  is name used in United States and parts of Canada for an unfiltered, unsweetened, non alcoholic beverage made from apples.
Apple cider is not to be confused with the alcoholic beverage known as cider in other places which is called hard cider in US and Canada.
Apple cider is the liquid extracted from an apple and all its components that is then boiled to concentration.
Once pressed mainly at farmsteads and local mills apple cider is easy and inexpensive to make.
Apple cider is typically opaque due to fine apple particles in suspension and generally tangier than commercial filtered apple juice.
Cider is typically pasteurized to kill bacteria and extend its shelf life but untreated cider is common.
In either form apple cider is seasonally produced in autumn.
Apple cider is traditionally served on the Halloween, Thanksgiving, Christmas and various New Year Eve holidays sometimes heated and mulled.
Boza also bosa, bozo is a popular fermented beverage.
Boza is a malt drink made by fermenting various grains maize and wheat in Albania wheat in Turkey wheat or millet in Bulgaria and Romania and barley in Egypt.
Boza has a thick consistency a low alcohol content and a slightly acidic sweet flavor.
Pibb Xtra is a reformulation of Mr.Pibb a soft drink created and marketed by The Coca Cola Company.
Pibb Xtra first introduced to compete with Dr Pepper.
Pibb Xtra has several variants.
Pibb Xtra is sold in bottles, cans, 2 liter bottles and is available in most Coca Cola Freestyle machines.
Mecca Cola is a cola flavoured carbonated beverage.
Mecca Cola is the flagship product of the Mecca Cola World Company.
​​Mecca Cola is marketed as an alternative to brands such as Coca Cola and Pepsi Cola to pro Muslim consumers.
Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
Roasted beans are ground and then brewed with near boiling water to produce the beverage known as coffee.
Coffee is darkly colored, bitter, slightly acidic and has a stimulating effect in humans primarily due to its caffeine content.
Coffee is one of the most popular drinks in the world.
Coffee can be prepared and presented in a variety of ways eg espresso, French press, caffè latte.
Coffee is usually served hot although iced coffee is a popular alternative.
Clinical studies indicate that moderate coffee consumption is benign or mildly beneficial in healthy adults.
The most common naturally caffeinated beverages are coffee and tea.
Horchata is a name given to various plant milk beverages of similar taste and appearance.
Ten High is a brand of American whiskey first introduced in the 1930s by Hiram Walker & Sons
Monopolowa originally a Polish brand is a vodka made in Austria by Gessler.
Monopolowa is distilled from potatoes.
Club soda is a manufactured form of unflavored carbonated water commonly used as a drink mixer.
Seltzer water is a similar manufactured carbonated water but lacks added mineral content.
Snapple is a brand of tea and juice drinks which is owned by Keurig Dr Pepper and based in Plano, Texas.
Snapple brand achieved some fame due to various pop culture references including television shows.
Eggnog, egg nog historically also known as milk punch or egg milk punch is a rich, chilled, sweetened, dairy based beverage.
Eggnog is traditionally made with milk, cream, sugar, whipped egg whites and egg yolks.
In some contexts distilled spirits such as brandy, rum, whisky or bourbon are added to eggnog.
Throughout Canada and United States the eggnog is traditionally consumed over the Christmas season from late November until the end of the holiday season.
Eggnog has also gained popularity in Australia.
A variety called Ponche Crema has been made and consumed in Venezuela and Trinidad since the 1900s also as part of the Christmas season.
During that time commercially prepared eggnog is sold in grocery stores in these countries.
Eggnog is also homemade using milk, eggs, sugar and flavorings and served with cinnamon or nutmeg.
While eggnog is often served chilled in some cases it is warmed particularly on cold days.
Eggnog or eggnog flavoring may also be used in other drinks such as coffee eg eggnog latte espresso.
Cracovia is Polish brand of vodka produced by distillery Polmos Kraków since 1995.
There are three varieties of this vodka Cracovia Classic, Cracovia Supreme and Cracovia Very Old.
Apéritifs and digestifs are drinks typically alcoholic that are normally served before or after a meal.
Qoo is a non carbonated beverage from the Coca Cola Company.
Qoo was introduced in Japan on May 28, 1999 in the Kyushu region.
When it was introduced Qoo completely replaced Hi C in Japan.
Qoo is now available throughout much of Asia in a variety of flavors including grape and orange.
Qoo was introduced white grape flavor was available at drink fountains in Japan as well at McDonald's as Coca Cola pushed this drink to market in many places.
In Germany the Qoo product line was sold from January 2003 until November 2005.
Additionally Qoo White Grape is available in Japan in McDonald's fountain machines nationwide.
Pepsi Twist is a lemon flavored cola marketed by PepsiCo as an alternative to regular Pepsi.
St.Ides is a malt liquor manufactured by the Pabst Brewing Company.
St.Ides contains 8.2% alcohol by volume which is stronger than many high alcohol malt liquors.
St.Ides was launched by the McKenzie River Corporation in 1987.
St.Ides gained prominence during the late 1980s and early 1990s through the use of celebrity endorsements by rap artists.
St.Ides is available in a number of St.Ides Special Brews which have a variety of flavorings including various fruit flavors.
Vernors is an American ginger soda brand.
Vernors was created in 1866 by James Vernor a Detroit pharmacist.
Tomato juice is a juice made from tomatoes.
Tomato juice usually used as a beverage either plain or in cocktails such as a Bloody Mary, a Caesar or Michelada.
Josta was a soft drink brand that was produced by PepsiCo.
Josta was first energy drink ever introduced by a major US beverage company.
Josta flavor has been described as predominantly fruity with a hint of spice and a touch of the key ingredient guaraná.
Josta was marketed as a high energy drink with guaraná and caffeine.
Josta was introduced in 1995 but PepsiCo pulled the drink from its lineup due to a change in corporate strategy in 1999.
Shortly before Josta was discontinued an Association for Josta Saving was started.
A Save Josta campaign was also launched by fans of Josta.
Kissel or kisel is a viscous fruit dish popular as a dessert and as a drink.
Kissel consists of the sweetened juice of berries like mors.
Kissel is thickened with cornstarch potato starch or arrowroot sometimes red wine or fresh or dried fruits are added.
Kissel is similar to the Danish rødgrød and German Rote Grütze.
Swedish blåbärssoppa is a similarly prepared bilberry dessert.
Kissel can be served either hot or cold also together with sweetened quark or semolina pudding.
Kissel can also be served on pancakes or with ice cream.
If kissel is made using less thickening starch it can be drunk and this is common in Poland, Russia and Ukraine.
Ancient Age is a brand of bourbon whiskey distilled in Frankfort Kentucky at the Buffalo Trace Distillery.
Ezra Brooks is a brand of Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey.
Ezra Brooks is primarily bottled at 40% abv or 45% abv.
Ezra Brooks brand was created by Frank Silverman in 1957.
Ezra Brooks was bottled at Hoffman Distilling Company in Lawrenceburg, Kentucky until Hoffman Distilling Co went out of business in the 1970s.
In 1993 Ezra Brooks was purchased by Luxco of St.Louis Missouri.
Ezra Brooks is distilled at Luxco Lux Row Distillers in bourbon county Bardstown Kentucky.
Luxco other whiskey brands Rebel Yell, David Nicholson and Blood Oath.
Old Crow is a low priced brand of Kentucky made straight bourbon whiskey distilled by Beam Suntory.
Beam Suntory also produces Jim Beam and several other brands of whiskey.
The current Old Crow product uses the same mash bill and yeast as Jim Beam.
The current Old Crow product is aged for a shorter period of time and mixed to a more lenient taste profile before bottling.
The Old Crow brand has a venerable history as one of Kentucky earliest bourbons.
The Old Crow is aged in barrels for a minimum of three years.
The Old Crow in the United States is 80 proof.
The slightly higher quality but inexpensive Old Crow Reserve is aged for a minimum of four years and is 86 proof.
OK Soda was a soft drink created by The Coca Cola Company in 1993.
OK Soda courted American Generation X demographic with unusual advertising tactics including neo noir design, chain letters and negative publicity.
After OK Soda did not sell well in select test markets it was officially declared out of production in 1995 before reaching nationwide distribution.
The OK Soda slogan was Things are going to be OK.
Sam Choice is a private label brand created by Cott Beverages for Walmart stores.
The brand was introduced as Sam's American Choice in 1991 and has since been shortened to simply Sam's Choice.
The Sam's Choice is named after Sam Walton the founder of Walmart.
Items produced under the Sam's Choice label primarily are grocery items.
More recently the Sam's Choice has expanded from mainly beverages to several other items.
Recent additions include Sam's Choice coffee and Sam's Choice Black Angus hamburger patties as well as Sam's Choice pizzas.
Coco López is a Puerto Rican coconut product which is used in many popular drinks.
Coco López was invented by Ramón López Irizarry an agricultural professor for the University of Puerto Rico.
Irizarry left university and commercialized Coco López which eventually found its way into the island's supermarkets.
Coco López was the base for the invention of the tropical drink piña colada.
Initially most piña coladas used Coco López to bring out the coconut flavor.
Nowadays various other coconut drinks are also used when making piña coladas.
Ramon Lopez the creator of Coco López was a WWI veteran.
Although Coco López packaging describes it as a cream of coconut it cannot be used as a substitute for coconut cream in Thai or other Southeast Asian cuisines.
The Coco López is sweetened for inclusion in piña coladas.
Sunny Delight marketed as SunnyD in some regions is a tangy orange flavored drink developed by Doric Foods of Mount Dora Florida in 1963.
Sunny Delight grew so popular that additional plants were built in California and Ohio in 1974 and 1978 respectively.
Sunny Delight drink produced an estimated $450 million in revenue for Procter & Gamble in 2004.
Sunny Delight beverage is also distributed by Dr Pepper Seven Up or DPSU.
In Canada the Sunny Delight is manufactured and distributed by Saputo.
Sunny Delight The beverage was launched in the United Kingdom in April 1998 with a £10 million promotional campaign.
By August 1999 Sunny Delight became the third biggest selling drink in the United Kingdom behind CocaCola and Pepsi.
Sunny Delight was sold in refrigerated cabinets and marketed as a healthier alternative to soft drinks.
SunnyD started out with only one flavor of drink orange.
Tereré or Terere is an infusion of yerba mate similar to mate but prepared with cold water and ice rather than with hot water and in a slightly larger vessel.
Tereré is originally from Paraguay and is found also in northeastern Argentina and southern and western Brazil.
Tereré was spread by the dwellers of that region and for centuries was a social beverage.
Tereré is believed to refresh the body and can be a very low calorie, non alcoholic beverage.
Tereré is an important ritual signifying trust and communion.
Many people drink tereré with added herbs both medicinal and refreshing.
In northeastern Argentina and southern and western Brazil the tereré is commonly prepared with citrus fruit juices like lime, orange and pineapple.
Mixing fruit juices with tereré is commonly called tereré ruso because this practice is more common with Slavic immigrants in the northeast of Argentina.
A&W Root Beer is a root beer brand primarily available in the United States and Canada.
A&W Root Beer was founded in 1919 by Roy W.Allen who partnered with Frank Wright in 1922.
They combined their initials to create the brand A&W and inspired a restaurant chain also founded in 1922.
Originally A&W root beer drinks sold for five cents.
Outside Canada the rights to A&W brand are owned by Keurig Dr Pepper.
A&W products are distributed via various U.S.bottlers.
A&W Cream Soda is a cream soda carbonated soft drink introduced by A&W Root Beer in 1986.
A&W Cream Soda and A&W Diet Cream Soda were introduced in 1986.
A&W Cream Soda is currently the top brand in cream sodas.
In 2017 A&W Cream Soda product was reformulated to be caffeine free.
Dutch Gold is a low cost imported pilsner lager beer sold only in Ireland.
Spruce beer is a beverage flavored with the buds, needles or essence of spruce trees.
Spruce beer can refer to either alcoholic or non alcoholic beverages.
Postum is a powdered roasted grain beverage popular as a coffee substitute.
Postum the caffeine free beverage was created by Post Cereal Company founder C.W.Post in 1895 and marketed as a healthful alternative to coffee.
Eliza's Quest Foods now owns the trademark rights and secret recipe of Postum.
The Postum instant drink mix version was developed in 1912 replacing the original brewed beverage.
The Postum is made from roasted wheat bran, wheat and molasses.
The Postum coffee flavored and cocoa flavored versions have been introduced.
Kompot or compot is a non alcoholic sweet beverage that may be served hot or cold depending on tradition and season.
Kompot is obtained by cooking fruit such as strawberries, apricots, peaches, apples, rhubarb, gooseberries or sour cherries in a large volume of water.
Kompot is obtained by cooking fruit often together with sugar or raisins as additional sweeteners.
Sometimes different spices such as vanilla or cinnamon are added for additional flavor especially in winter when Kompot is usually served hot.
Kompot  is popular in Central and Eastern European countries as well as in Scandinavia.
Virginia Gentleman is a brand of bourbon whiskey distilled in Kentucky and re distilled in Virginia.
Virginia Gentleman brand motto was The Aristocrat of Them All.
Clamato is a commercial drink made of reconstituted tomato juice concentrate and sugar which is flavored with spices dried clam broth and MSG.
Made by Mott's the name clamato is a portmanteau of clam and tomato.
The clamato is also referred to colloquially as clamato juice.
The clamato is consumed in the United States, Canada and Mexico.
In 1935 The Clamato Corporation of New York produced clam and tomato juice in combination.
In 1940 Lobster King Harry Hackney was granted the Clamato trademark.
His Atlantic City restaurant Hackney's sold Clamato juice in cans.
The Clamato brand name for the seasoned blend of tomato juice and clam juice.
Clamato was produced in its current form beginning in 1966 by Duffy Mott company in Hamlin, New York by Francis Luskey a chemist.
Employees named new cocktail Mott's Clamato and secured trademark for the new brand.
Cel Ray is a celery flavored soft drink from Dr Brown's.
Cel Ray is fairly easy to find in New York City, Philadelphia, Baltimore and in South Florida but rather obscure elsewhere.
Country Time is a brand of non carbonated lemon flavored drink mix and soft drink.
Country Time powdered mix is produced by Kraft Foods.
Country Time bottles and cans of ready to drink versions of the line are available.
Crystal Light is a lemonade powdered beverage mix produced by Kraft Foods.
Crystal Light was released in 1982 originally by now defunct company General Foods.
Crusha is a brand of milkshake mix sold in United Kingdom and Australia.
Crusha brand first appeared in the 1950s and was bought by British Sugar.
Crusha in December 2001 came under the Silver Spoon brand.

Papelón con limón is a refreshing Venezuelan beverage made with papelón, water and lemon or lime juice.

Krupnik or Krupnikas is a traditional sweet alcoholic drink similar to a liqueur.
Krupnik is based on grain spirit usually vodka and honey popular in Poland, Belarus and Lithuania.

Coca Cola Raspberry is a Coca Cola drink with a raspberry flavor that was sold in New Zealand on a trial basis.

Boilo is a traditional Christmas or Yuletide drink in the Coal Region of northeastern and east central Pennsylvania.
Boilo a variation of a traditional Lithuanian liqueur called Krupnik or Krupnikas.
Characteristically boilo has a standard recipe including citrus fruits, herbs and spices and other ingredients such as honey and ginger ale.
The traditional base ingredient in boilo is moonshine.
Modern boilo recipes have replaced home brewed moonshine with blended whiskey, rye or grain alcohol.
Some boilo recipes specify Four Queens Whiskey.
Variations on the traditional recipe include honeyberry boilo, tomata boilo, blueberry boilo and apple pie boilo.
Decorating accompany the cooking process to add to the festive effect of boilo.
As with krupnik some believe boilo to have curative properties for the onset of fall related ailments such as a cold or influenza.
There are many boilo taste test contests held annually in the Coal Region of Pennsylvania.
Home brewers compete over whose recipe is most authentic and whose boilo is the most easy drinking.
The Annual Pfeiffenberger boilo Contest is among the most prestigious and intense of such contests.
Dozens of family boilo recipes are judged and a series of voting parameters and rounds of taste testing decide the winner.

Nalewka plural nalewki is a traditional alcohol from Poland.
Similar to medicinal tinctures nalewka is usually 40% to 45% alcohol by volume some can be as strong as 75%.
Nalewka is created by macerating or infusing various ingredients in alcohol usually vodka or neutral spirits.
Among the nalewka ingredients often used are fruits, herbs, spices, roots, sugar and honey.
The name nalewka is currently being registered for national appellation within the European Union.
Unlike ordinary liqueurs nalewkas are usually aged.
Since nalewka is produced by infusion rather than distillation, liquid is typically colorful and somewhat opaque.
Taste wise nalewka is similar to fruit liqueurs such as schnapps or eau de vie.
Taste wise nalewka is similar to fruit liqueurs but is usually sweeter and lacks a strong alcohol taste.
The name nalewka is sometimes misleadingly used for a variety of commercially produced alcohols sold in Poland.
The nalewka could also be confused with its cognate nalivka or nalyvka.
Ukrainian or Russian nalivkas are made by filling a jar with fruit, sugar and water, sealing and letting the contents ferment.
While the Polish nalewka is an infusion.
Ukrainian or Russian nalivkas are much weaker usually containing less than 20% alcohol.
The proper name for a Russian analogue of a Polish nalewka would be nastoika, infusion.
